title: Major League Baseball Stadiums
description: What an adventure it would be to see every Major League Baseball stadium!  Each has its own quirks and ambiance. This is Ordered alphabetically by stadium name, and only includes the current stadium for each team.

questEntries.title: Angel Stadium (Los Angeles Angels)
questEntries.description: Angels Stadium has a capacity of 45,477 (as of 2018) and is located in Anaheim, California.  It has an open roof, a grass playing surface, and is considered 'Retro Modern'.

questEntries.title: AT&T Park (San Francisco Giants)
questEntries.description: AT&T Park has a capacity of 41,915 (as of 2018) and is located in San Francisco, California.  It has an open roof, a grass playing surface, and is considered 'Retro Classic'.

questEntries.title: Busch Stadium (St. Louis Cardinals)
questEntries.description: Busch Stadium has a capacity of 45,529 (as of 2018) and is located in St. Louis, Missouri.  It has an open roof, a grass playing surface, and is considered 'Retro Classic'.

questEntries.title: Chase Field (Arizona Diamondbacks)
questEntries.description: Chase Field has a capacity of 46,686 (as of 2018) and is located in Phoenix, Arizona.  It has an retractable roof, a grass playing surface, and is considered 'Retro Modern'.

questEntries.title: Citi Field (New York Mets)
questEntries.description: Citi Field has a capacity of 41,922 (as of 2018) and is located in Queens, New York.  It has an open roof, a grass playing surface, and is considered 'Retro Classic'.

questEntries.title: Dodger Stadium (Los Angeles Dodgers)
